Specifies how many rows and columns a matrix has. (Not necessary if you use GetMatrix to obtain a matrix that Amos has calculated.)

Evaluates the discrepancy function and its 1st derivatives.
0 = no error The discrepancy function The first order derivatives
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Evaluates the discrepancy function and its 1st derivatives. Evaluate2a evaluates approximate 2nd derivatives. EvaluateEx2a evaluates the inverse of the matrix of approximate 2nd derivatives.
0 = no error The discrepancy function The first order derivatives Approximate 2nd derivatives
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Evaluates the discrepancy function and its 1st derivatives. Evaluate2a evaluates approximate 2nd derivatives. EvaluateEx2a evaluates the inverse of the matrix of approximate 2nd derivatives.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Specifies a matrix of estimates

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the variable numbers associated with the rows of a matrix in group number 1. (Variables are numbered starting with 1.)
Specifies a matrix of estimates
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Specifies a matrix of estimates

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the variable names associated with the columns of a matrix of estimates.
Specifies a matrix of estimates The column names A group number. The first group is group number 1.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the variable names associated with the columns of a matrix of estimates, for group number 1
Specifies a matrix of estimates The column names
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Declares that the GetBootSampleEstimates method will be used later to get a matrix of estimates from an individual bootstrap sample.
Specifies a matrix of estimates
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls the display of detailed information about the solution obtained for each permutation when the Permute method is used.
If true, displays detailed information.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to perform the bootstrap procedure of Bollen and Stine (1992) for testing the hypothesis that the specified model is correct.
If true, performs the bootstrap procedure of Bollen and Stine (1992).
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Speeds up the bootstrap algorithm and makes it more reliable under the assumption that standard errors are inversely proportional to the square root of sample size.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Uses Fisher's scoring method in the case of maximum likelihood estimation (ml), or the Gauss-Newton method in the case of least squares estimation (Uls, Sls, Gls or Adf).
Use Fisher's scoring method or the Gauss-Newton method for this many iterations, then switch over to exact 2nd derivatives
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Since the previous call to this function, has there been an attempt to compute an implied correlation that failed because of a negative implied variance? This function can be called at any time.
[jim] 6/29/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Since the previous call to this function, has there been an attempt to compute an 'all implied' correlation that failed because of a negative implied variance? This function can be called at any time.
[jim] 6/29/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Since the previous call to this function, has there been an attempt to compute a standardized effect (direct, indirect or total) that failed because of a negative implied variance? This function can be called at any time.
[jim] 6/29/2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether a parametric bootstrap or a nonparametric bootstrap (Efron and Tibshirani, 1993) is performed.
If true, performs a parametric bootstrap.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls the reporting of statistics for assessing multivariate normality of the observed variables.
If true, reports the statistics.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether Amos uses a special random number generator that is common to all versions of Amos.
If true, uses the special random number generator.
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls the reporting of detailed information about individual bootstrap samples.
If true, reports the detailed information.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to display the squared multiple correlation between each endogenous variable and the variables (other than residual variables) that directly affect it.
If true, displays the squared multiple correlations.
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Displays the squared multiple correlation between each endogenous variable and the variables (other than residual variables) that directly affect it.
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether Amos displays an estimate of the covariance matrix of the parameter estimates.
If true, displays an estimate of the covariance matrix of the parameter estimates.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether Amos displays an estimate of the correlation matrix of the parameter estimates.
If true, displays an estimate of the correlation matrix of the parameter estimates.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether Amos displays a 'critical ratio' for each pair of parameter estimates. The critical ratio for a pair of parameter estimates provides a test of the hypothesis that the two parameters are equal.
If true, displays the critical ratios..
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Displays a 'critical ratio' for each pair of parameter estimates. The critical ratio for a pair of parameter estimates provides a test of the hypothesis that the two parameters are equal.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to display regression weights for predicting the unobserved variables from the observed variables.
If true, displays the regression weights.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to display the implied means, variances and covariances of the observed variables.
If true, displays the implied means, variances and covariances.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to display the sample covariance matrix and (if means and intercepts are explicitly modeled) the sample means.
If true, displays the sample covariance matrix and (if means and intercepts are explicitly modeled) the sample means.
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls displaying of the difference between the sample moments (means, variances and covariances) and the implied moments.
If true, displays the difference between the sample moments (means, variances and covariances) and the implied moments.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether the covariance matrix of estimates is estimated by inverting the approximate second derivatives or the exact second derivatives.
If true, inverts the exact second derivatives.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether non-unique variables are allowed to covary by default.
If true, allows non-unique variables to covary by default.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that any sample covariances read from a data file are unbiased estimates of the corresponding population covariances.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies that any sample covariances read from a data file are (biased) maximum likelihood estimates of the corresponding population covariances.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to display information about the progress of minimization of the discrepancy function.
If true, displays information about the progress of minimization of the discrepancy function.
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether Amos attempts to obtain maximum likelihood estimates even if a sample covariance matrix is not positive definite.
If true, attempts to obtain maximum likelihood estimates even if a sample covariance matrix is not positive definite.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies whether to display standardized parameter estimates (correlations among exogenous variables, and standardized regression weights).
If true, displays standardized parameter estimates.
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Displays standardized parameter estimates (correlations among exogenous variables, and standardized regression weights).
[jim] 7/6/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Simplified form of the BeginGroupEx method.
The name of the data file The grouping variable The grouping value. The analysis includes those cases for which the grouping variable takes on this value.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Simplified form of the BeginGroupEx method.
The name of the data file The name of a data table within the data file The grouping variable The grouping value. The analysis includes those cases for which the grouping variable takes on this value.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the data file, and begins the model specification for a single group.
A database format specifier The name of the data file The name of a data table within the data file
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the data file, and begins the model specification for a single group.
A database format specifier The name of the data file The name of a data table within the data file The grouping variable The grouping value. The analysis includes those cases for which the grouping variable takes on this value.
[jim] 7/3/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls whether the GetEstimates method returns symmetric matrices as square two-dimensional arrays or as one-dimensional arrays that contain only the lower triangle.
If true, the GetEstimates method will return symmetric matrices as one-dimensional arrays that contain only the lower triangle.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Assigns values to the matrix of sample covariances, where sample covariances are stored as a one-dimensional array. See Help for warnings about the use of this method.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Assigns values to the matrix of sample covariances in group number 1, where sample covariances are stored as a one-dimensional array. See Help for warnings about the use of this method.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Assigns values to the sample covariances and the sample means when sample covariances are stored as a one-dimensional array.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Assigns values to the sample covariances and the sample means in group number 1 with the lower triangle of the covariance matrix stored as a one-dimensional array.
[jim] 7/5/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.AmosEngine.IUserValue.Value(System.Int32,System.Int32,AmosEngineLib.CValue)
member.summary: Return the value of the user-defined estimands for the original sample or for a single bootstrap sample. The Value function may return either a double (if there is a single user-defined estimand), or an array of doubles (if there are multiple user-defined estimnands).
member.param: The Value function should return the value of the user-defined estimands for the group specified by groupNumber.

The Value function is called with bootstrapSampleNumber=1 for the first bootstrap sample, bootstrapSampleNumber=2 for the second bootstrap sample, and so on. It is called with bootstrapSampleNumber=0 for the original sample.

An object that provides access to parameter estimates and other pre-calculated estimates for a single sample. You may use these estimates as a starting point for calculating estimates of your own estimands. (Type 'u.' to get a list of properties and methods that you can use to access Amos's parameter estimates and other pre-calculated estimates.)

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetTotalEffectsMatrix(System.Double[0:,0:]@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@)
member.summary: Gets the matrix of total effects. As an alternative, you can use GetTotalEffectsElement to get the total effect of one variable on another.
member.param: The matrix of total effects. Each row and each column corresponds to a single model variable. The elements of the matrix give the effects of the column variables on the row variables. In other words, the column variables affect the row variables.
A list of the variables that correspond to the rows of the matrix of total effects.
A list of the variables that correspond to the columns of the matrix of total effects.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetTotalEffectsElement(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets one element of the matrix of total effects, giving the total effect of one variable on another. As an alternative, you can use GetTotalEffectsMatrix to get the entire matrix of total effects.
member.param: The name of the "dependent" variable for which you want to estimate the total effect of some other variable.
The name of the "independent" variable whose total effect on some other variable you want to estimate.
member.returns: One element of the matrix of total effects, giving the total effect of one variable on another.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetTotalEffectsElement(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets one element of the matrix of total effects, giving the total effect of one variable on another. As an alternative, you can use GetTotalEffectsMatrix to get the entire matrix of total effects.
member.param: The "dependent" variable for which you want to estimate the total effect of some other variable.
The "independent" variable whose total effect on some other variable you want to estimate.
member.returns: One element of the matrix of total effects, giving the total effect of one variable on another.

A list of the variables that correspond to the columns of the matrix of direct effects.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetFactorScoreWeightsMatrix(System.Double[0:,0:]@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@)
member.summary: Gets the matrix of factor score weights. As an alternative, you can use GetFactorScoreWeightsElement to get one element of the matrix of factor score weights.
member.param: The matrix of factor score weights. The rows of the matrix correspond to the unobserved variables in the model. The columns correspond to the observed variables. The elements of the matrix give the regression weights for using the observed variables to predict the unobserved variables.
A list of the variables that correspond to the rows of the matrix of factor score weights.
A list of the variables that correspond to the columns of the matrix of factor score weights.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetFactorScoreWeightsElement(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets one element of the matrix of factor score weights, giving the regression weight applied to one of the observed variables in predicting one of the latent variables. As an alternative, you can use GetFactorScoreWeightsMatrix to get the entire matrix of factor score weights.
member.param: The name of one (predicted) latent variable.
The name of one observed variable (which acts as a predictor).

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetFactorScoreWeightsElement(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets one element of the matrix of factor score weights, giving the regression weight applied to one of the observed variables in predicting one of the latent variables. As an alternative, you can use GetFactorScoreWeightsMatrix to get the entire matrix of factor score weights.
member.param: A (predicted) latent variable.
An observed variable (which acts as a predictor).

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetRegressionWeightList
member.summary: Gets the estimated regression weights.
member.returns: A list of 'OrderedPairAndValue' objects. Each 'OrderedPairAndValue' object consists of a dependent variable (the 'to' variable), an independent variable (the 'from' variable), and a regression weight.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetMeanList
member.summary: Gets the estimated means for the exogenous variables.
member.returns: A list of 'VariableAndValue' objects. Each 'VariableAndValue' object consists of an exogenous variable and a mean.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetInterceptList
member.summary: Gets estimates of the intercepts in the regression equations for predicting the endogenous variables.
member.returns: A list of 'VariableAndValue' objects. Each 'VariableAndValue' object consists of an endogenous variable and an intercept.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetCovarianceList
member.summary: Gets the covariances among exogenous variables.
member.returns: A list of 'UnorderedPairAndValue' objects. Each 'UnorderedPairAndValue' object consists of two variables and a covariance.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetVarianceList
member.summary: Gets the variances of exogenous variables.
member.returns: A list of 'VariableAndValue' objects. Each 'VariableAndValue' object consists of an exogenous variable and a variance.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetStandardizedRegressionWeightList
member.summary: Gets the standardized regression weights.
member.returns: A list of 'OrderedPairAndValue' objects. Each 'OrderedPairAndValue' object consists of a dependent variable (the 'to' variable), an independent variable (the 'from' variable), and a standardized regression weight.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetCorrelationList
member.summary: Gets the correlations among exogenous variables.
member.returns: A list of 'UnorderedPairAndValue' objects. Each 'UnorderedPairAndValue' object consists of two variables and a correlation.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetSmcList
member.summary: Gets a list of squared multiple correlations for the endogenous variables.
member.returns: A list of 'VariableAndValue' objects. Each 'VariableAndValue' object consists of an endogenous variable and a squared multiple correlation.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetSmc(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the squared multiple correlation for an endogenous variable.
member.param: The name of an endogenous variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetSmc(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets the squared multiple correlation for an endogenous variable.
member.param: An endogenous variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedCovariancesMatrix(System.Double[]@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@)
member.summary: Gets the implied covariance matrix for the observed variables. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedCovariancesElement to get the implied covariance between two observed variables or the implied variance of a single observed variable.
member.param: The implied covariance matrix. The returned matrix contains only the non-redundant diagonal and subdiagonal elements.
A list of the variables that correspond to the rows (and also the columns) of the implied covariance matrix.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedCovariancesElement(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets one element of the implied covariance matrix for the observed variables, giving the implied covariance between two observed variables. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedCovariancesMatrix to get the entire matrix of implied covariances.
member.param: The name of an observed variable.
The name of an observed variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedCovariancesElement(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets one element of the implied covariance matrix for the observed variables, giving the implied covariance between two observed variables. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedCovariancesMatrix to get the entire matrix of implied covariances.
member.param: An observed variable.
An observed variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedCorrelationsMatrix(System.Double[]@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@)
member.summary: Gets the implied correlation matrix for the observed variables in the model. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedCorrelationsElement to get the implied correlation between two observed variables.
member.param: The implied correlation matrix. The returned matrix contains only the non-redundant diagonal and subdiagonal elements.
A list of the variables that correspond to the rows (and also the columns) of the implied correlation matrix.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedCorrelationsElement(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets one element of the implied correlation matrix for the observed variables, giving the implied correlation between two observed variables. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedCorrelationsMatrix to get the entire matrix of implied correlations.
member.param: The name of an observed variable.
The name of an observed variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedCorrelationsElement(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets one element of the implied correlation matrix for the observed variables, giving the implied correlation between two observed variables. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedCorrelationsMatrix to get the entire matrix of implied correlations.
member.param: An observed variable.
An observed variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedMeansVector(System.Double[]@,AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList@)
member.summary: Gets the implied means vector for the observed variables. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedMeansElement to get the implied mean of a single observed variable.
member.param: A vector of implied means.
A list of the variables that correspond to the elements of the implied means vector.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetImpliedMeansElement(System.String)
member.summary: Gets one element of the implied means vector for the observed variables, giving the implied mean for a single observed variable. As an alternative, you can use GetImpliedMeansVector to get the entire vector of implied means.
member.param: The name of an observed variable whose implied mean you want.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetGroupName
member.summary: Gets the name of the group for which estimates and sample moments are available during this call to the Value method.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.GetGroupName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the name of a group.
member.param: A group number, where groupNumber=1 for the first group.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.IsModelingMeansAndIntercepts
member.summary: Gets a boolean value that indicates whether means and intercepts are explicit model parameters.
member.returns: True if means and intercepts are explicit model parameters, false otherwise.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.NumberOfGroups
member.summary: Gets the number of groups.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.NumberOfParameters
member.summary: Gets the number of parameters.

member.summary: Gets information about a parameter.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ParameterName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the name of a parameter.
member.param: An integer index that identifies a parameter uniquely. parameterIndex ranges from 1 to n, where n is the number of parameters.
member.returns: A parameter name, which will be an empty string for parameters that are not named.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ParameterNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an integer index that identifies a parameter uniquely.
member.param: The parameter name. (Note that some parameters may be unnamed.)
member.returns: An integer index that identifies a parameter uniquely. The index ranges from 1 to n, where n is the number of parameters.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ParameterValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a parameter value.
member.param: The parameter name. (Note that some parameters may be unnamed.)

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ParameterValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a parameter value.
member.param: An integer index that identifies a parameter uniquely. parameterIndex ranges from 1 to n, where n is the number of parameters.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ParameterVector(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Gets a vector of all parameter values.
member.param: The vector of parameter values.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ListOfObservedVariables
member.summary: Gets a list of the observed variables in the model.
member.returns: The list of observed variables in the model.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ListOfUnobservedVariables
member.summary: Gets a list of the unobserved variables in the model.
member.returns: The list of unobserved variables in the model.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.ListOfEndogenousVariables
member.summary: Gets a list of the endogenous variables in the model.
member.returns: The list of endogenous variables in the model.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValue.VariableFromName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a 'variable object' (i.e., an object of type 'variable'). A 'variable' object contains information about a variable, such as its name, whether it is exogenous, etc.
member.param: A variable name.
member.returns: A 'variable' object (i.e., an object of type 'variable').

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValueSimple.ImpliedCovariance(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets the implied covariance between two observed or latent variables. This method cannot be used to get the implied covariance between a unique variable (such as an error variable) and another variable.

An observed or latent variable

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValueSimple.ImpliedCorrelation(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets the implied correlation between two observed or latent variables. This method cannot be used to get the implied correlation between a unique variable (such as an error variable) and another variable.
member.param: An observed or latent variable
An observed or latent variable

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValueSimple.ImpliedMean(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets the implied mean for a single observed or latent variable. This method cannot be used to get the implied mean of a unique variable (such as an error variable).
member.param: An observed or latent variable

An observed variable

An observed variable

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValueSimple.FactorScoreWeight(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable,AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)

An observed predictor variable

member.summary: Gets the sample mean for a single observed variable.

member.name: M:AmosEngineLib.CValueSimple.Smc(AmosEngineLib.t.Variable)
member.summary: Gets the squared multiple correlation between an endogenous variable and its predictors.

member.summary: Gets the intercept in the regression equation for predicting an endogenous variable.

member.name: T:AmosEngineLib.t.Variable
member.summary: An object that provides information about a single model variable.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.Variable.Name
member.summary: Gets the variable's name.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.Variable.IsUnique
member.summary: Gets a boolean value that indicates whether the variable is a unique variable (i.e., is unobserved and exogenous, and affects only one other variable).
member.value: True if the variable is a unique variable.
member.returns: True if the variable is a unique variable.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.Variable.IsEndogenous
member.summary: Gets a boolean value that indicates whether the variable is endogenous.
member.value: True if the variable is endogenous.
member.returns: True if the variable is endogenous.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.Variable.IsObserved
member.summary: Gets a boolean value that indicates whether the variable is observed.
member.value: True if the variable is observed.
member.returns: True if the variable is observed.

member.name: T:AmosEngineLib.t.VariableList
member.summary: The VariableList class inherits from Generic.List(Of Variable). VariableList does not have any members other than the members of Generic.List(Of Variable). The VariableList class is provided only as shorthand for Generic.List(Of Variable).

member.name: T:AmosEngineLib.t.VariableAndValue
member.summary: A VariableAndValue object consists of a model variable together with a numeric value that is associated with the variable. For example, a VariableAndValue object might contain a variable and its variance, or a variable and its mean.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.VariableAndValue.variable
member.summary: Gets a 'variable' object. A 'variable' object contains information about a variable, such as its name, whether it is exogenous, etc.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.VariableAndValue.value
member.summary: Gets a numeric value that is associated with a model variable (for example, the variable's mean or variance).

member.name: T:AmosEngineLib.t.OrderedPairAndValue
member.summary: An OrderedPairAndValue object consists of an ordered pair of variables and a numeric value associated with the pair. For example, it might consist of an independent variable, a dependent variable, and a regression weight.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.OrderedPairAndValue.fromVariable
member.summary: Gets a 'variable' object that refers to an independent variable. A 'variable' object contains information about a variable, such as its name, whether it is exogenous, etc.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.OrderedPairAndValue.toVariable
member.summary: Gets a 'variable' object that refers to a dependent variable. A 'variable' object contains information about a variable, such as its name, whether it is exogenous, etc.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.OrderedPairAndValue.value
member.summary: Gets a numeric value, either a regression weight or a standardized regression weight, that is associated with an ordered pair of variables.
member.returns: The regression weight or standardized regression weight.

member.name: T:AmosEngineLib.t.UnorderedPairAndValue
member.summary: An UnorderedPairAndValue object consists of an unordered pair of variables and a numeric value associated with the pair. For example, it might consist of two variables and their correlation.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.UnorderedPairAndValue.variable1
member.summary: Gets a 'variable' object. A 'variable' object contains information about a variable, such as its name, whether it is exogenous, etc.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.UnorderedPairAndValue.variable2
member.summary: Gets a 'variable' object. A 'variable' object contains information about a variable, such as its name, whether it is exogenous, etc.

member.name: P:AmosEngineLib.t.UnorderedPairAndValue.value
member.summary: Gets a numeric value, such as a correlation or covariance, that is associated with an unordered pair of variables.
